citation.article-title: Nesterenkonia alba sp. nov., an alkaliphilic actinobacterium isolated from the black liquor treatment system of a cotton pulp mill.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nesterenkonia alba sp. nov.
Nesterenkonia alba (al′ba. L. fem. adj. alba white, referring to the colour of colonies of the organism).
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, non-spore-forming, short rods, 0.4–0.6 μm in width and 0.8–1.2 μm in length.
Colonies on solid LB medium are white, smooth, circular and approximately 0.9–1.2 mm in diameter at 42 °C at 48 h.
The surface of the colonies is moist and glistening.
Growth occurs at 20–50 °C and pH 8–12, and with 0–6 % (w/v) NaCl.
Optimum conditions for growth are 42 °C and pH 9–10, with 3 % NaCl.
Catalase-positive but negative for oxidase, urease and the methyl red reaction.
Does not produce H2S or indole.

Glucose, arabinose, sucrose, maltose, xylitol, melibiose, melezitose, raffinose, trehalose and glycerol are utilized, but mannose, fructose, xylose, d-galactose, α-d-lactose, arabitol, cellobiose, adonitol and sorbitol are not.
Negative for hydrolysis of starch and positive for hydrolysis of Tween 80 and gelatin.
Acid is not produced from d-galactose, lactose, xylose or mannitol.
Major menaquinones are MK-7 (9.7 %), MK-8 (54.8 %) and MK-9 (35.5 %).

Fatty acids are anteiso-C17 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 1A, iso-C16 : 0, C18 : 0, summed feature 8 (C18 : 1ω7c and/or C18 : 1ω6c), C18 : 1ω9c , iso-C17 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, C14 : 0, C10 : 0, C12 : 0, summed feature 5 (C18 : 2ω6,9c and/or anteiso-C18 : 0) and summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or C16 : 1ω6c).
Cell-wall peptidoglycan type is A4α, Lys–Gly-d-Asp.
Polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and unidentified glycolipids.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.2 mol%.
The type strain, CAAS 252T (=CCTCC AB 207011T=DSM 19423T), was isolated from the black liquor treatment system of a cotton pulp mill in Wuhan, China.
